verses.verse: Moreover <S%H347>Job<s%> <S%H3254>continued<s%> his <S%H4912>parable<s%>, and <S%H559>said<s%>,
As <S%H410>God<s%> <S%H2416>lives<s%>, who has taken <S%H5493>away<s%> my <S%H4941>judgment<s%>; and the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%>, who has <S%H4843>troubled<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%>;
All the <S%H5750>while<s%> my <S%H5397>breath<s%> is in <S%H7307>me<s%>, and the spirit of <S%H433>God<s%> is in my <S%H639>nostrils<s%>;
My <S%H8193>lips<s%> shall not <S%H1696>speak<s%> <S%H5766>wickedness<s%>, nor my <S%H3956>tongue<s%> <S%H1897>utter<s%> <S%H7423>deceit<s%>.
God <S%H2486>forbid<s%> that I should <S%H6663>justify<s%> <S%H1478>you<s%>: until I die I will not <S%H5493>remove<s%> my integrity from <S%H8538>me<s%>.
My <S%H6666>righteousness<s%> I <S%H2388>hold<s%> <S%H7503>fast<s%>, and will not let it go: my <S%H3824>heart<s%> shall not <S%H2778>reproach<s%> me so long as I <S%H3117>live<s%>.
Let my <S%H341>enemy<s%> be as the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>, and he that rises <S%H6965>up<s%> against me as the <S%H5767>unrighteous<s%>.
For what is the <S%H8615>hope<s%> of the <S%H2611>hypocrite<s%>, though he has <S%H1214>gained<s%>, when <S%H433>God<s%> takes <S%H7953>away<s%> his <S%H5315>soul<s%>?
Will <S%H410>God<s%> <S%H8085>hear<s%> his <S%H6818>cry<s%> when <S%H6869>trouble<s%> comes upon <S%H935>him<s%>?
Will he <S%H6026>delight<s%> himself in the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%>? will he <S%H6256>always<s%> <S%H7121>call<s%> upon <S%H433>God<s%>?
I will <S%H3384>teach<s%> you by the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of <S%H410>God<s%>: that which is with the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%> will I not <S%H3582>conceal<s%>.
<S%H2372>Behold<s%>, all you yourselves have seen <S%H1892>it<s%>; why then are you thus altogether <S%H1891>vain<s%>?

This is the <S%H2506>portion<s%> of a <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H120>man<s%> with <S%H410>God<s%>, and the <S%H5159>heritage<s%> of <S%H6184>oppressors<s%>, which they shall <S%H3947>receive<s%> of the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%>.
If his <S%H1121>sons<s%> be <S%H7235>multiplied<s%>, it is <S%H3926>for<s%> the <S%H2719>sword<s%>: and his <S%H6631>offspring<s%> shall not be <S%H7646>satisfied<s%> with <S%H3899>bread<s%>.
Those that <S%H8300>remain<s%> of him shall be <S%H6912>buried<s%> in <S%H4194>death<s%>: and his <S%H490>widows<s%> shall not <S%H1058>weep<s%>.
Though he heap <S%H6651>up<s%> <S%H3701>silver<s%> as the <S%H6083>dust<s%>, and <S%H3559>prepare<s%> <S%H4403>clothes<s%> as the <S%H2563>clay<s%>;
He may <S%H3559>prepare<s%> <S%H6662>it<s%>, but the just shall put it <S%H3847>on<s%>, and the <S%H5355>innocent<s%> shall <S%H2505>divide<s%> the <S%H3701>silver<s%>.
He <S%H1129>builds<s%> his <S%H1004>house<s%> as a <S%H6211>moth<s%>, and as a <S%H5521>shelter<s%> that the <S%H5341>keeper<s%> <S%H6213>makes<s%>.
The <S%H6223>rich<s%> man shall lie <S%H7901>down<s%>, but he shall not be <S%H622>gathered<s%>: he <S%H6491>opens<s%> his <S%H5869>eyes<s%>, and he is not.
<S%H1091>Terrors<s%> take <S%H5381>hold<s%> on him as <S%H4325>waters<s%>, a <S%H5492>storm<s%> steals him <S%H1589>away<s%> in the <S%H3915>night<s%>.
The <S%H6921>east<s%> wind carries him <S%H5375>away<s%>, and he <S%H3212>departs<s%>: and as a storm <S%H8175>hurls<s%> him out of his <S%H4725>place<s%>.
For God shall <S%H7993>cast<s%> upon <S%H2550>him<s%>, and not spare: he would <S%H1272>fain<s%> <S%H1272>flee<s%> out of his <S%H3027>hand<s%>.
Men shall <S%H5606>clap<s%> their <S%H3709>hands<s%> at <S%H8319>him<s%>, and shall hiss him out of his <S%H4725>place<s%>.
